record.description: Cone-shaped sample of carbon quickly becomes white hot as it is lowered into atomic vapor produced by a new water-stabilized arc developed at the University of Chicago. Temperature of the electric arc is over 25,000 degrees Fahrenheit, twice as hot as the surface of the sun.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Attached caption, Pr stamps. Some copies list date at Sept, 1957. Am using earlier date assigned to press release.
